特記事項:
本授業科目は、“オンライン授業60単位制限対象科目”ではありません。
The course is not subject to the 60-credit limit for online courses.
授業方法:
Lecture. Seminar.

Each lecture begins with a 15 minute lecture. Then students work through the computer assignments on their own, and ask questions as needed Students use Python and Excel to complete the assignments.

Requirements:
A computer with the Mac or Windows operating system
Python3 (free, see LUNA for a link to the webpage to download it)
Microsoft Excel
Microsoft Word
The data package for the course downloaded from the internet (see the LUNA for a link)
WinRAR (a free program used to unpack RAR files, see LUNA for a link)

IMPORTANT: If you are not able to use Python3 on your computer, then you will not be able to do the course assignments. Please confirm that you have met the requirements before enrolling in the course. See the LUNA webpage for details.

第1回:
Lesson 0: The Basics
Keyboard commands; running Python; reading in data; copying data from Python into Excel
第2回:
Lesson 1: The Corpora
The different corpora and their characteristics; counting words; lexical diversity
第3回:
Lesson 2: Frequency
The top twenty words; differences between written speech and spoken speech
第4回:
Lesson 2: Frequency
The top twenty words; differences between men and women
第5回:
Lesson 3: Part of Speech
Proper nouns; differences between the corpora; differences between men and women
第6回:
Lesson 3: Part of Speech
Adverbs; differences between the corpora; differences between men and women
第7回:
Lesson 4: Noun to Verb Ratio
Noun to verb ratio; differences between the corpora; differences between men and women
第8回:
Lesson 4: Noun to Verb Ratio
Mini project
第9回:
Lesson 5: Concordance
Discover differences in the usage of 中国, 日本, and 韓国 using concordance data
第10回:
Lesson 5: Concordance
Discover differences in the verb usages using concordance data
第11回:
Lesson 6: Language Change
Using corpora to observe changes in how the words なんか and みたいな are used
第13回:
Lesson 7: Language Change II
Using corpora to observe changes in how the words すごい and 全然 are used
